text: Firefighters are exposed to harsh chemicals on the job, and develop cancer at higher rates as a result. I've been pushing for a bipartisan bill to create a national cancer registry to collect better data so we can help protect our firefighters. As we reform our broken and failed drug laws, we need to make sure we focus on restorative justice, like they’re doing in Seattle. Too many people’s lives have been ruined because of our regressive policies. https://www.theroot.com/seattle-vacates-hundreds-of-marijuana-possession-charge-1825622917
2018 is the most important year of our lives. To quote @DoloresHuerta: “Every moment is an organizing opportunity, every person a potential activist, every minute a chance to change the world.”

RT @RoKhanna Social security isn’t an “entitlement” when Americans have been paying into the program for their whole lives. When there are seniors in this country living off $12,000 per year social security, it's clear that rather than cutting benefits, we should be expanding them.
Medicaid does more than help low-income Americans afford health care, it also pays for everything from treatment for substance abuse to support for children with special needs. We must protect it.
